definition: armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
armpit
limb
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: Please put this thermometer under your armpit and let me feel your pulse.
sentences.chinese: 將溫度計放在腋窩裏面，用胳肢窩夾住它。

sentences.english: The axilla is the medical term for the armpit.
sentences.chinese: 腋窩是“胳肢窩”的醫學術語。

sentences.english: Do you know how to make arm farts ?
sentences.chinese: 你知道怎樣用胳肢窩放屁嗎？

sentences.english: Place the thermometer in the armpit with arms crossed over the chest.
sentences.chinese: 將溫度計放在腋窩裏面，用胳肢窩夾住它。

definition: to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
neck
see 屎蚵螂[shi3 ke1 lang2]
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to censor an image/to pixelate
boar
to make eyes/to wink
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to talk nonsense/to bullshit
leisurely/unhurried/sluggish
to form a scar/to form a scab
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
buttock cleavage/butt crack
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
